and i also love their sharpie labeling of boards/components
<@U026103R3> @anyone do we know what the existing exhibits in the San Bruno space are?

good question, if you take a look at the pictures of the space in the onboarding folder we were given access to i think you'll see some, like the digital campfire that we have the example creative understandings doc from
otherwise i think <@U0265G76F> would have more info since he's been in the space
also, remember that the existing wall we're going to be working on is just a big blank wall at the moment
<@U02613K0X>: let me know if you can't access those photos and i'll get them to you one way or another
there is also an interactive table that is connected to a tv

<@U026103R3> I'm not sure if I have access? Are they on the NAS? Sorry if I've just not been playing close enough attention. I'm mostly asking out of curiosity of what other people are doing in there. Another reason is that the IS docs keep mentioning that one of its features is the ability to reuse input across exhibits. For example, if there was an exhibit that processed input data from a leap motion somehow, we could use that same data in our exhibit. Not that we'd necessarily want to of course.
make total sense! i just shared with you the onboarding folder
from there just go into the folder labeled The Space and you should see the photos
not that it answers all of the questions, but that will give you access to those
<@U02613K0X>: we can also ask Josh what other exhibits they have and lastly, we can make sure to get info on them and document when the team is down there on 10/7
Sounds good. thank you!!!

Just seeing this (and about to hit road back from Eugene):

They have the table justin mentioned, a photo booth, a huge digital board (shown in photos on their on boarding kit), a digital campfire, and a wall that I believe has android tablets enclosed in picture frames
That's all inside the space
screeeeeeeeeeens!
Outside they have multiple projectors that illuminate the walkway and walls as well as a LED entryway that has motion piece connected to said projectors
unrelated, but I found this and thought it was very interesting, and reminded me of John’s thesis project: <http://magazine.good.is/articles/string-quartert-global-warming-music>

attachments.title: Here’s 133 Years of Climate Change Data Transformed Into a Haunting Melody for String Quartet
attachments.text: How one college student uses NASA data to create a musical representation of climate change.
attachments.fallback: GOOD Magazine: Here’s 133 Years of Climate Change Data Transformed Into a Haunting Melody for String Quartet

text: AND in the bathroom they have some sort of thing that I really don't remember much about. I want to say it was data via using toilet paper
woah, can't wait to see the bathroom..
